alert.note: Alert for Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 3:22PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Kansas, including the following counties, Harper, Kingman, Sedgwick and Sumner. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM CDT, Between 4 and 7 inches of rainfall has occurred across parts of the warning area, especially across Harper, southwest Sedgwick and northwest Sumner counties. Numerous county roads have been reported to be water covered and will likely remain that way overnight.
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown.
